title: How to Get Started with Nextjs
content:
Introduction to Next.js

Next.js is a popular React framework that simplifies building server-rendered applications. It offers various features that enhance the performance and development experience.

Getting Started

Begin by installing Next.js using the following command:

npx create-next-app

Folder Structure

Explore the folder structure and understand the conventions of Next.js to get familiar with how to organize your application.

Rendering Techniques

Static Site Generation (SSG)

Learn about static site generation (SSG) for pre-rendering pages at build time, which improves performance and SEO.

Server-Side Rendering (SSR)

Understand server-side rendering (SSR) for rendering pages on each request, providing up-to-date content and improved user experience.

Creating and Styling Pages

Create and style your pages using built-in components. Next.js makes it easy to build dynamic and responsive web pages.

API Routes

Familiarize yourself with API routes for adding backend functionality to your application. Next.js allows you to create API endpoints within your application structure.

Integrating Data Sources

Integrate external data sources and APIs into your application to fetch and display dynamic data.

Optimization Features

Image Optimization

Utilize the Next.js image optimization feature to automatically optimize images for better performance.

Automatic Code Splitting

Take advantage of automatic code splitting to reduce the size of your JavaScript bundles, improving load times and performance.

Deployment

Deploy your Next.js application to platforms like Vercel, which provides seamless integration and easy deployment.

Continuous Learning

Continuously explore advanced features and best practices for optimizing your application to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in Next.js.
